ygData.subject: Re: FLOWING BLACK SILK SASH TEST
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Its a rare drop off a rare mob, the Frenzied frogluk. Depending on the spawn, you only need a full lvl 40 group to take the room, and or an intrepid lvl 50
ygData.messageBody:
At 12:40 PM 9/27/1999 -0700, you wrote:
>From: jhenders@...
>
>On Mon, Sep 27/99, Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...> wrote:
>> From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>
>>
>> At 06:23 AM 9/27/99 -0700, you wrote:
>>
>> >>From these results it is easy to see that the Flowing Black Silk Sash and
>> >Anthem de Arms do indeed Stack thier Speed increases. In Fact, when
>> >Comined
>> >together their enhancements are far Better than the sum of thier parts. In
>> >some way when comBined they totally rule. Using Both the Sash and Singing
>> >Anthem De Arms I took a 21/7 weapon down to a 14/7 one, and a 24/8 down to
>> >15/8. These are phenomenal stats. Get a Sash when you can. They are
>> >great
>> >stuff.
>>
>> >From EQ Lizer:
>> "This is one of the most sought after items in the game for melee classes.
>> It is worn in your belt slot. It increases your attack speed by roughly 25%
>> and can be found in Lower Guk."
>
>Another note on the sash, while the test posted showed it with a L27
>bard, you can forget getting one until you can take a tough group of
>L45+ players into lower guk, unless your guild is very pro-twinking.
>
>

Its a rare drop off a rare mob, the Frenzied frogluk. Depending on the
spawn, you only need a full lvl 40 group to take the room, and or an
intrepid lvl 50 necromancer (yes, a lvl 50 necro can solo that room with a
bit of luck using charm). However, if you see 2 bloodthirsties and 1
frenzied spawn in the room... well you better hope a lull doesnt fail :).
Of course i have seen 1 wan, 1 dar, and some pansy caster frogluk spawn
there before, in which case seperate out the spawn as much as possible and
you wont have much of a problem.
But thats not what i wanted to post, i wanted to post that this test,
while i had fun reading about it, doesnt really mean anything. You would
have to repeat this test at least 3 times for each equipment set to even
start to see meaningful results. And the biggest flaw is the fact that the
sand beetle he tested it on varies in level, which would have another
impact on the numbers. Need to find an npc that spawns at the same lvl
everytime to perform a test like this.

Course i have never even taken a statistics class so i could be way off on
this :)
